title: Do tools like OptinMonster annoy you?
text:
Personally they drive me nuts. Especially the "exit intent" popups. If I want to close my tab, don't try to stop me (right?).

Consider the real-world equivalent... You're in a store, decide to leave, start to push open the door, someone slams it shut (preventing you from leaving), then they start waving a coupon in your face and blathering all sorts of marketing talk. How would you react?

Why is there not a bigger backlash to such practices?

Ask HN: Curated list of JavaScript-free/lite sites?
text:
Even sites that are progressively enhanced well enough to offer a nice, usable initial render?
I am looking for weather, news, stock tickers, etc. I accept that Google's suite of apps won't load without JS.
